TITLE: Serving FastStream API Documentation with FastAPI
DESCRIPTION: Python function that creates a FastAPI application to serve FastStream API documentation. It accepts parameters for document handling and returns a configured FastAPI app with appropriate routes and templates.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/cli/docs/app/serve.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def serve(
    docs_module: str | None = None,
    app_path: str | None = None,
    app_var: str | None = None,
    title: str | None = None,
    host: str = "127.0.0.1",
    port: int = 8000,
    reload: bool = True,
    log_level: Literal["debug", "info", "warning", "error", "critical"] = "info",
) -> None:
    """Serve API documentation.

    Args:
        docs_module: module with docs configuration
        app_path: path to the application module
        app_var: application variable name
        title: API title
        host: host to serve on
        port: port to serve on
        reload: reload server on code changes
        log_level: logging level
    """
    import tempfile
    from pathlib import Path

    from fastapi import FastAPI
    from fastapi.staticfiles import StaticFiles
    from starlette.templating import Jinja2Templates
    from uvicorn import Server, Config

    app = FastAPI()

    template_path = Path(__file__).parent / "templates"
    app.mount("/static", StaticFiles(directory=template_path / "static"), name="static")
    templates = Jinja2Templates(directory=template_path)

    with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tmpdir:
        app, url_path = get_documentation_app(
            docs_module, app_path, app_var, title, app, templates, tmpdir
        )

        config = Config(
            app=app,
            host=host,
            port=port,
            log_level=log_level,
            reload=reload,
        )
        server = Server(config)

        print(f"Documentation server started at http://{host}:{port}{url_path}")

        import asyncio

        asyncio.run(server.serve())
```

    broker: str,

    Args:

        ssl_keyfile: The client key file for SSL/TLS.

TITLE: Checking If Subprocess Has Started in FastStream CLI
DESCRIPTION: A utility function that checks if a subprocess has successfully started by comparing its logs against a predefined pattern or waiting for a specific process ID. It returns a boolean indicating whether the subprocess has started correctly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/cli/supervisors/utils/subprocess_started.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def subprocess_started(
    output: list[str],
    log_pattern: str = None,
    pid: int = None,
    stdout_pattern: str = None,
    stderr_pattern: str = None,
) -> bool:
    """Check if subprocess started."""
    # Process matching by pid
    if pid is not None:
        try:
            # Check if process exists
            psutil.Process(pid)
            return True
        except psutil.NoSuchProcess:
            return False

    # No logs
    if not output:
        return False

    # Process matching by log pattern
    if log_pattern is not None:
        for line in output:
            if re.search(log_pattern, line):
                return True

    if stdout_pattern is not None:
        for line in output:
            if re.search(stdout_pattern, line):
                return True

    if stderr_pattern is not None:
        for line in output:
            if re.search(stderr_pattern, line):
                return True

    # Default - no matches
    return False
```

TITLE: Parsing Handler Parameters for AsyncAPI Messages in Python
DESCRIPTION: This function parses handler parameters for AsyncAPI message handlers. It extracts information about the parameters, including their names, types, and default values. The function handles various parameter types and annotations, including path parameters, query parameters, and body fields.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/asyncapi/message/parse_handler_params.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def parse_handler_params(func: Callable[..., Any]) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    """Parse handler parameters.

    Args:
        func (Callable[..., Any]): The handler function to parse.

    Returns:
        Dict[str, Any]: A dictionary containing parsed parameter information.
    """
    signature = inspect.signature(func)
    params = {}

    for name, param in signature.parameters.items():
        if name == "self":
            continue

        annotation = param.annotation
        default = param.default

        if isinstance(annotation, str):
            annotation = eval(annotation)

        if annotation == inspect.Parameter.empty:
            annotation = Any

        if default == inspect.Parameter.empty:
            default = Required

        params[name] = {
            "type": annotation,
            "default": default,
        }

    return params
```

TITLE: Creating and Using TestApp in FastStream Applications
DESCRIPTION: The TestApp class provides testing utilities for FastStream applications, allowing simulation of messages, handling of responses, and verification of application behavior. It inherits from TestClient and serves as a core component in testing message-driven applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/TestApp.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class TestApp(TestClient):
    """TestApp for FastStream applications."""

    __test__ = False

    def __init__(
        self,
        app: _AppT,
        include_router: bool = True,
        *,
        apply_types: bool = False,
        patch_all: bool = False,
        broker_id: str | None = None,
    ) -> None:
        """Initialize TestApp.

        Args:
            app: FastStream application instance
            include_router: add router's handlers to test app
            apply_types: apply types validation to handled message
            patch_all: patch all publishers with test publishers
            broker_id: specific broker to test
        """
        self.app = app
        self.include_router = include_router

        super().__init__(
            apply_types=apply_types,
            patch_all=patch_all,
            broker_id=broker_id,
        )
```

TITLE: Path Class Definition in FastStream's utils.context.builders Module
DESCRIPTION: The Path class is part of FastStream's utilities for context building, providing functionality for handling path strings in routing. It maintains a base string value and supports various string operations and validations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/utils/context/builders/Path.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class Path(str):
    """A string that represents a path.

    Attributes:
        base (str): A base string value.
    """

    def __new__(cls, base: str = "") -> "Path":
        return super().__new__(cls, base)

    def __init__(self, base: str = "") -> None:
        self.base = base

    def __truediv__(self, value: str) -> "Path":
        return Path(
            f"{self.base.rstrip('/') if self.base else ''}/{value.lstrip('/')}"
            if value
            else self.base
        )

    def __eq__(self, other) -> bool:
        if isinstance(other, Path):
            return self.base == other.base

        return str(self) == other

    def __hash__(self) -> int:
        return hash(str(self))

    def __bool__(self) -> bool:
        return bool(self.base)
```

TITLE: Resolving Payload Schemas for AsyncAPI in Python
DESCRIPTION: Function that converts various schema representations (pydantic models, dictionaries, AsyncAPI schemas) into properly formatted AsyncAPI payload objects. It handles type coercion and ensures schemas are in the correct format for AsyncAPI documentation generation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/asyncapi/utils/resolve_payloads.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def resolve_payloads(
    payloads: dict[str, list[Any]],
    *,
    schema_registry: dict[str, Schema] | None = None,
) -> dict[str, list[dict]]:
    if not payloads:
        return {}

    schemas = {}
    for message_type, lst in payloads.items():
        if not lst:
            continue

        schemas[message_type] = []
        for message in lst:
            if isinstance(message, Schema) or (
                isinstance(message, dict) and "schema" in message
            ):
                schemas[message_type].append(message)
            elif schema := _to_Schema(message, schema_registry=schema_registry):
                schemas[message_type].append(schema)

    return schemas
```

TITLE: Compiling Path Patterns in FastStream
DESCRIPTION: This function compiles path patterns with dynamic parameters. It supports both regex-format and f-string-format path patterns, replacing named parameters with actual values. The function handles path normalization for both formats.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/utils/path/compile_path.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def compile_path(
    pattern: str, param_values: Dict[str, Any] = None
) -> str:
    """Compile path pattern with dynamic parameters.

    Supports both regex-format:
        "user/{user_id}/info"
    and f-string-format path:
        "user/{user_id}/info"

    Args:
        pattern: Path pattern string
        param_values: Path parameters values.
            If not provided, the path pattern will be returned as is.

    Returns:
        Compiled path string.

    """
    if not param_values:
        return pattern

    # Check if using regex-format pattern
    if "{" in pattern and "}" in pattern:
        formatted_path = pattern
        for param_name, param_value in param_values.items():
            formatted_path = formatted_path.replace(
                f"{{{param_name}}}", str(param_value)
            )
        return formatted_path

    return pattern
```

TITLE: Defining Path Utility Class in Python for FastStream
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the Path utility class for FastStream. It includes methods for path manipulation and comparison, as well as special methods for representation and equality checking.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/utils/Path.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class Path(str):
    def __new__(cls, *args: str) -> Self:
        return str.__new__(cls, "/".join(args).strip("/"))

    def __truediv__(self, other: str) -> Self:
        return type(self)(self, other)

    def __rtruediv__(self, other: str) -> Self:
        return type(self)(other, self)

    def __eq__(self, other: object) -> bool:
        if not isinstance(other, (str, Path)):
            return NotImplemented
        return str(self) == str(other)

    def __repr__(self) -> str:
        return f"Path('{self}')"

    @property
    def parts(self) -> tuple[str, ...]:
        return tuple(self.split("/"))

    def startswith(self, prefix: str, /) -> bool:
        return str(self).startswith(prefix)

    def endswith(self, suffix: str, /) -> bool:
        return str(self).endswith(suffix)
```

TITLE: Defining ExchangeType Enum in Python for FastStream RabbitMQ
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines an Enum class called ExchangeType which represents the different types of exchanges available in RabbitMQ. It includes DIRECT, FANOUT, TOPIC, and HEADERS as the enum members.

TITLE: Applying Message Pattern in FastStream RabbitMQ Testing (Python)
DESCRIPTION: The apply_pattern function modifies a message based on a specified pattern, supporting both simple string replacement and complex dictionary transformations. It checks whether a pattern exists and applies the pattern to the message content accordingly.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/rabbit/testing/apply_pattern.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def apply_pattern(
    message: bytes | bytearray,
    pattern: str | dict[str, Any] | None,
) -> RabbitPayload:
    """Modify message with a pattern.

    Args:
        message: message to modify
        pattern: pattern to apply

    Returns:
        Modified message
    """
    if pattern is None or message == b"":
        return message

    message_str = message.decode()

    if isinstance(pattern, dict):
        message_dict = json.loads(message_str)
        message_dict.update(pattern)
        message_str = json.dumps(message_dict)
    else:
        message_str = pattern

    return message_str.encode()
```

TITLE: Extracting Function Calls from 'with' Statements using Python AST
DESCRIPTION: A utility function that extracts function calls from 'with' statements in Python code using the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST). It parses provided source code and returns a list of call nodes found within 'with' statement contexts.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/utils/ast/get_withitem_calls.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def get_withitem_calls(source: str) -> list[ast.Call]:
    """Get a list of call nodes from a with statement.

    Args:
        source: Python source code string

    Returns:
        list of call nodes
    """
    module = ast.parse(source)
    calls = []
    for node in ast.walk(module):
        if isinstance(node, ast.With):
            for item in node.items:
                if isinstance(item.context_expr, ast.Call):
                    calls.append(item.context_expr)
    return calls
```

TITLE: Validating Binding Arguments in FastStream CLI
DESCRIPTION: This function checks if a string matches a specific pattern to determine if it's a binding argument. It uses regular expressions to verify that the string follows the format 'key=value' where 'key' doesn't start with a hyphen (-). This is commonly used in command-line argument parsing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/cli/utils/parser/is_bind_arg.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def is_bind_arg(arg: str) -> bool:
    """
    Check if argument is a binding argument.

    Parameters
    ----------
    arg : str
        The argument to check

    Returns
    -------
    bool
        True if argument is a binding argument
    """
    return bool(arg) and "=" in arg and not arg.startswith("-")
```

TITLE: Creating Prometheus Settings Provider Factory for Confluent in Python
DESCRIPTION: Factory function that creates Prometheus settings for Confluent integration. It takes optional parameters including a registry, namespace, and subsystem to configure how metrics are collected and labeled in Prometheus.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/confluent/prometheus/provider/settings_provider_factory.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def settings_provider_factory(
    registry: Optional[CollectorRegistry] = None,
    namespace: str = "",
    subsystem: str = "",
) -> Dict[str, PrometheusMetricsProvider]:
    """Create confluent prometheus settings provider.

    Args:
        registry: metrics registry
        namespace: metrics namespace
        subsystem: metrics subsystem

    Returns:
        Dict with settings provider
    """
    from prometheus_client import CollectorRegistry as PrometheusRegistry

    from faststream.confluent.prometheus.provider import PrometheusMetricsProvider

    return {"provider": PrometheusMetricsProvider(registry or PrometheusRegistry(), namespace, subsystem)}
```

TITLE: Setting Exit Handler in FastStream CLI
DESCRIPTION: This function allows registering a callback to be executed when the application receives termination signals. It handles both SIGTERM and SIGINT signals for graceful shutdown, utilizing Python's signal module.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/cli/supervisors/utils/set_exit.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
def set_exit(callback, *args, **kwargs):
    """Set an exit handler for graceful shutdown of an application.

    Args:
        callback (Callable): The function to be called when the application exits.
        *args: Arguments to pass to the callback.
        **kwargs: Keyword arguments to pass to the callback.
    """
    def handler(signum, frame):
        return callback(*args, **kwargs)

    signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, handler)
    signal.signal(signal.SIGINT, handler)
```

TITLE: Implementing Asynchronous User Retrieval in FastStream
DESCRIPTION: This endpoint retrieves all users from the database using an asynchronous SQLAlchemy query. It executes a SELECT statement and returns the results as a list of User models.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/getting-started/dependencies/class.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
@router.subscriber("get_users")
async def get_users(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db)) -> List[User]:
    result = await db.execute(select(User))
    users = result.scalars().all()
    return [User.from_orm(user) for user in users]
```

TITLE: Defining NoCast Utility Class in Python for FastStream
DESCRIPTION: This code snippet defines the NoCast class, which is used to prevent automatic type casting of values in FastStream. It includes a __repr__ method for string representation.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/api/faststream/utils/no_cast/NoCast.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
class NoCast:
    """Prevent auto casting of value"""

    def __init__(self, value: Any) -> None:
        self.value = value

    def __repr__(self) -> str:
        return f"NoCast({self.value!r})"
```

TITLE: Implementing TelemetryMiddleware with AIOKafka Broker
DESCRIPTION: Example of adding TelemetryMiddleware to an AIOKafka broker for tracing message processing.
SOURCE: https://github.com/ag2ai/faststream/blob/main/docs/docs/en/getting-started/observability/opentelemetry/index.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: python
CODE:
```
from faststream import FastStream
from faststream.kafka import KafkaBroker
from faststream.telemetry import TelemetryMiddleware

# Create broker
broker = KafkaBroker(middlewares=[TelemetryMiddleware()])

# Create application
app = FastStream(broker)


@broker.subscriber("input")
